UCz9zdQIvT2FocqkZtOfMWkA.textOriginal: @0reo2 True, but that was back in the time where Moore's law was still in full force. Processors two years apart were magnitudes more powerful than their predecessors. Now we're hitting component shrinking and heat barriers, and that increase is slowing down. So components 15 years from now won't be as many magnitudes more powerful compared to today, as our components today are compared to 15 years ago. The best we can hope for is software optimizations, or that we somehow stumble upon a completely different hardware architecture or discover a fantastic new material for making electronics.
